targets.expr: count by (instance, job) (count by (instance, job, cpu) (node_cpu_seconds_total{instance=~"$node",job="$job"}))
count by (instance, job) (count by (instance, job, cpu) (node_cpu_seconds_total{instance=~"$node",job="$job"}))

panels.description: System load average over 1, 5, and 15 minutes. Reflects the number of active or waiting processes. Values above CPU core count may indicate overload
panels.title: CPU Load

panels.description:
System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Processes executing in user mode
IOwait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when in a VE
Irq - Servicing interrupts

matcher.options: Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_guest_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval]))) > 0

panels.title: CPU Usage - $node

panels.description: RAM and swap usage overview, including caches
panels.title: Memory - $node

panels.description: Percentage of filesystem space used for each mounted device

targets.expr: ((node_filesystem_size_bytes{instance="$node", job="$job", device!~"rootfs"} - node_filesystem_avail_bytes{instance="$node", job="$job", device!~"rootfs"}) / node_filesystem_size_bytes{instance="$node", job="$job", device!~"rootfs"}) * 100

panels.title: Disk Used - $node

panels.description: Percentage of filesystem space used for each mounted device
panels.title: Disk Available - $node

panels.description: Monitors hardware sensor temperatures and critical thresholds as exposed by Linux hwmon. Includes CPU, GPU, and motherboard sensors where available
panels.title: Temperature

panels.description: Duration of each individual collector executed during a Node Exporter scrape. Useful for identifying slow or failing collectors
panels.title: Node Exporter Scrape Time
